title: British banks urge dismissal of multibillion US Libor court case
text:
British banks including Barclays, Lloyds and HSBC are battling fresh allegations that they manipulated the scandal-hit benchmark Libor, urging US courts to dismiss a multibillion-dollar claim as out of bounds.

Papers filed in New York this year and seen by The Telegraph claim that 18 banks – including RBS, Deutsche Bank, UBS, JP Morgan, Bank of America and Citigroup – “corrupted” the rate-setting process by submitting lower rates to New York Stock Exchange owner ICE.

However the defendants have now asked the judge to dismiss the case, new court filings reveal.

The banks are fighting back as they believe the claim has “various legal deficiencies,” one person familiar with the matter said.

These...
description: British banks including Barclays, Lloyds and HSBC are battling fresh allegations that they manipulated the scandal-hit benchmark Libor, urging US courts to dismiss a multibillion-dollar claim as out of bounds.
